FuncDef: The display access-user command displays information about NAC access users. The display access-user command displays information about NAC access users. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
CLIs: display access-user event { pre-authen | authen-fail | client-no-response | authen-server-down }

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about users assigned with a specified service scheme.
The value must be the name of an existing service scheme.

Displays information about users in a specified authentication phase.
-

Displays information about users in the pre-connection phase.
-

Displays information about users who fail the authentication and are assigned network access policies when the authentication server sends authentication failure packets to the device.
-

Displays information about users who fail the authentication and are assigned network access policies when the authentication server is down.
-

Displays information about users who fail the authentication and are assigned network access policies when the authentication server is down.
-

Displays information about online NAC users using a specified authentication mode.
-

Displays information about online 802.1X authentication users.
-

Displays information about users whose AAA scheme is non-authentication.
-
